sections.1_identificacion_vehiculo: Mitsubishi L200, Year 2013, Protocol SAE J1939 CAN, Engine and VIN not specified.
sections.2_motivo_visita: Customer reports airbag warning light illuminated on the dashboard.
sections.3_resultado_escaneo: No Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) stored. Malfunction Indicator Lamp (MIL) is off. Readiness monitors for MIL and Components are complete; other monitors are not available or not supported.
sections.4_evidencia_datos_en_vivo: Engine coolant temperature at 20°C, engine RPM at 0 rpm, vehicle speed at 0 km/h, throttle position and commanded throttle actuator at 100%, control module voltage at 12.12 V, intake manifold pressure at 90 kPa. Accelerator pedal positions at 0%.
sections.5_interpretacion_tecnica: No DTCs related to the airbag system were retrieved via the SAE J1939 CAN protocol scan. The MIL is off, indicating no powertrain faults detected. Live data shows the engine is off or idling with throttle fully open, which may be a scan artifact or key-on engine-off state. The absence of airbag-related codes suggests the airbag control module may require a dedicated scan tool or protocol for fault retrieval.

6_causas_probables.causa: Fault or communication issue in the airbag control module not detectable via generic SAE J1939 CAN scan.
Wiring or connector fault in the Supplemental Restraint System (SRS) circuit causing the airbag light to illuminate.
Faulty airbag warning light bulb or dashboard cluster issue.

7_pruebas_recomendadas.criterio_confirmacion: Presence of airbag-related DTCs confirms fault in airbag control module or related components.
7_pruebas_recomendadas.descripcion: Perform a dedicated SRS/airbag system scan using manufacturer-specific diagnostic equipment or protocol to retrieve airbag-related DTCs.

7_pruebas_recomendadas.criterio_confirmacion: Identification of wiring faults or connector issues confirms cause.
7_pruebas_recomendadas.descripcion: Visually inspect and test wiring harness and connectors related to the airbag system for continuity, corrosion, or damage.

7_pruebas_recomendadas.criterio_confirmacion: If the bulb fails to illuminate or behaves abnormally, cluster or bulb fault is confirmed.
7_pruebas_recomendadas.descripcion: Check the airbag warning light operation on the instrument cluster for bulb functionality and proper illumination during key-on self-test.

8_acciones_recomendadas.accion: Repair or reprogram the airbag control module as per manufacturer procedures after confirming fault codes.
8_acciones_recomendadas.causa: Fault or communication issue in the airbag control module not detectable via generic SAE J1939 CAN scan.

8_acciones_recomendadas.accion: Repair or replace damaged wiring or connectors in the SRS circuit.
8_acciones_recomendadas.causa: Wiring or connector fault in the Supplemental Restraint System (SRS) circuit causing the airbag light to illuminate.

8_acciones_recomendadas.accion: Replace the airbag warning light bulb or repair/replace the instrument cluster as needed.
8_acciones_recomendadas.causa: Faulty airbag warning light bulb or dashboard cluster issue.

sections.9_notas_limitaciones: Scan was performed using a generic SAE J1939 CAN protocol adapter (ELM327 v1.5) which may not support airbag system diagnostics. No airbag-specific DTCs were retrieved. Live data indicates engine off or key-on state; throttle data may not reflect actual driving conditions. Confirmation requires manufacturer-specific diagnostic tools.
